case_vignette:
A 17-year-old boy is brought to the physician because of increasing pain and swelling of his right knee for 12 days. He has had episodes of pain with urination for 3 weeks. He had a painful, swollen left ankle joint that resolved without treatment one week ago. His mother has rheumatoid arthritis. He is sexually active with 2 female partners and uses condoms inconsistently. He appears anxious. His temperature is 38°C (100.4°F), pulse is 68/min, and blood pressure is 100/80 mm Hg. Examination shows bilateral inflammation of the conjunctiva. The right knee is tender, erythematous, and swollen; range of motion is limited by pain. There is tenderness at the left Achilles tendon insertion site. Genital examination shows no abnormalities. Laboratory studies show:
Hemoglobin 14.5 g/dL
Leukocyte count 12,300/mm3
Platelet count 310,000/mm3
Erythrocyte sedimentation rate 38 mm/h
Serum
Urea nitrogen 18 mg/dL
Glucose 89 mg/dL
Creatinine 1.0 mg/dL
Urine
Protein negative
Blood negative
WBC 12–16/hpf
RBC 1–2/hpf
An ELISA test for HIV is negative. Arthrocentesis is done. The synovial fluid is cloudy and a Gram stain is negative. Analysis of the synovial fluid shows a leukocyte count of 26,000/mm3 and 75% neutrophils.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?"

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Rheumatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing increasing pain and swelling in my right knee for 12 days and also had episodes of pain while urinating for 3 weeks.
Are you currently taking any medications for these symptoms?
No, I haven't been taking any medications for these symptoms.
Do you have any medical history of illness or chronic conditions?
My mother has rheumatoid arthritis, but I haven't mentioned any personal medical history of chronic conditions.
Do you have any history of recent infections or fever?
Yes, I currently have a fever with a temperature of 38°C (100.4°F).
Understood. Do you have any other joint pain or swelling in addition to your right knee?
Yes, I had a painful, swollen left ankle joint that resolved on its own about a week ago.
Final Diagnosis: Reactive Arthritis
